intro: Stachys kurdica var. brevidens, commonly known as the short-leaved hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and have a distinctive purple color. This variant is noted for its compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
